Instructions: In a small saucepan, combine oats and milk. Bring to a simmer.
Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the oats are soft and the mixture thickens.
Stir in the peanut butter until well combined.
Top with sliced banana and serve warm.
Heat olive oil in a skillet on medium heat. Sauté onion, garlic, and bell pepper until softened.
Add crumbled tofu to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently.
Mix in black beans and spinach. Cook until heated through and spinach is wilted.
Season with salt, pepper, and spices like cumin or turmeric if desired. Serve hot.
Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, garlic, and carrots for 5 minutes.
Add diced potatoes, lentils, and tomatoes. Pour in 6 cups of water (or broth) and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until lentils and potatoes are tender.
Stir in fresh spinach during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.
Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until golden.
Add diced sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes and cook until they break down into a sauce.
Add chickpeas and a splash of water. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until sweet potatoes are tender.
Stir in fresh spinach until wilted. Season with curry powder, salt, and pepper as desired.
Serve the curry over hot cooked brown rice.
Cook the whole wheat pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes to form a sauce. Season with salt, pepper, and Italian herbs if available.
Stir in the drained tuna and fresh spinach. Cook until spinach wilts and tuna is heated through.
Toss the cooked pasta with the sauce. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese sprinkled on top.
Heat olive oil in a pot. Sauté onion, garlic, and bell pepper until softened.
Add diced sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes (with juice if using canned) and bring to a simmer.
Add black beans. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper to taste. Serve hot, optionally over cooked brown rice.
Heat half the olive oil in a large pan or wok. Scramble the eggs and set aside.
In the same pan, add remaining oil and sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add carrots and broccoli, stir-frying until tender. Then add diced cooked chicken to warm it.
Stir in the cooked brown rice, breaking up any clumps. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
Mix in the scrambled eggs. Season with soy sauce (if available) or salt and pepper. Serve hot.
In a bowl, mix mashed banana, egg, milk, and flour until a batter forms.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or pan over medium heat.
Pour batter onto the griddle to form pancakes of desired size.
Cook until bubbles form and edges are dry, then flip and cook the other side until golden.
Serve warm. Optionally top with additional banana slices or a drizzle of peanut butter.
In a glass or bowl, layer half of the yogurt, then half of the banana slices.
Sprinkle with oats, then repeat with remaining yogurt and banana.
Warm the peanut butter slightly if needed, then drizzle it over the top of the parfait.
Enjoy immediately as a quick breakfast or snack.
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Wash sweet potatoes and pierce them with a fork a few times. Bake for 40-45 minutes until tender.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a pan. Add minced garlic and chickpeas, cooking for 5-7 minutes and seasoning with salt, pepper, and spices as desired.
Stir in fresh spinach with the chickpeas and cook until just wilted, then remove from heat.
Slice baked sweet potatoes open lengthwise. Fill each with the sautéed chickpeas and spinach.
Top with a dollop of yogurt (seasoned with a pinch of salt and garlic if desired) and serve warm.
Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion, garlic, carrots, and zucchini for 5 minutes.
Add shredded cabbage and tomatoes, cooking until the tomatoes soften.
Stir in chickpeas and 6 cups of water (or vegetable broth). Bring to a boil.
Add the whole wheat pasta and cook for about 10 minutes until al dente.
Season with salt, pepper, and Italian herbs as desired. Serve hot.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add cabbage, stir-fry 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Push cabbage aside, scramble eggs, then combine.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Heat olive oil, sauté onion, garlic, and carrots 5 minutes.
Add lentils, 4 cups water, spices. Simmer 25 minutes.
Adjust seasoning. Serve with bread or rice.
Toast bread.
Spread peanut butter.
Top with apple slices. Serve.
Heat oil, sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add chickpeas, cook 3-4 minutes.
Stir in spinach, cook until wilted. Season.
Serve as side or main.
Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Serve chilled or over ice.
Toast bread slice.
Top with sardines and diced tomatoes.
Season with pepper or herbs. Serve.
Heat oil, sauté onion and garlic.
Add eggs, scramble until set.
Stir in rice, cook 3-4 minutes. Season. Serve.
Sauté onion and carrots in olive oil.
Add lentils, cook 5 minutes.
Transfer to dish, top with mashed potatoes.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 20 minutes.
Mash chickpeas with onion.
Spread on bread, top with spinach.
Fold or roll into wrap. Serve.
Bake potatoes at 200°C (400°F) for 40 minutes.
Sauté garlic in oil, add beans, heat through.
Slice potatoes, top with beans. Serve.
Heat olive oil, sauté garlic and vegetables 5 minutes.
Add pasta, toss well. Season with soy sauce or spices.
Serve hot.
Heat oil, sauté onion and tofu 5 minutes.
Add spinach, cook until wilted.
Season with turmeric, salt, pepper.
Sauté onion, garlic, carrots, mushrooms 5 minutes.
Add lentils, 4 cups water, simmer 25 minutes.
Season and serve.
Mix all ingredients into a batter.
Form patties, pan-fry in olive oil until golden.
Serve with yogurt or dip.
Mix all ingredients, press into baking dish.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25 minutes.
Cool, slice into bars.

instructions: Cook pasta until al dente; reserve 1/4 cup cooking water and drain.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil; sauté minced garlic, sliced bell pepper and broccoli florets 4 min.
Add diced Spanish mackerel; cook 3–4 min until opaque.
Toss with pasta and reserved water for 1 min and serve.
Dice apple; combine with lentils and spinach in a bowl.
Add flaked, chilled salmon.
Drizzle olive oil; season lightly and toss.
Dust tuna cubes lightly with flour.
Sear in hot oil 1 min per side; remove.
Stir-fry garlic, sliced mushrooms and zucchini noodles 3 min.
Return tuna; toss 30 s and plate.
Grate sweet potatoes; squeeze excess moisture.
Sauté onions and grated sweet potatoes 6 min.
Add flaked cooked flathead; stir 2 min.
Make 2 wells; crack eggs, cover and cook 4–5 min until set.
Warm tortillas in dry pan.
Heat oil; sauté diced bell pepper 3 min.
Add black beans and flaked mackerel; heat 2 min.
Fill tortillas and serve.
Boil and mash potatoes; cool.
Combine with salmon, grated apple, beaten egg and flour.
Shape 6 patties; pan-fry 3 min each side.
Dip fillets in milk then coat with ground oats.
Pan-fry in oil 4 min per side.
Steam broccoli; serve alongside.
Cook pasta; reserve 1/4 cup water, drain.
Sauté garlic and sliced mushrooms 3 min.
Add crushed tomatoes; simmer 4 min.
Add sardine fillets; poach 3 min until opaque.
Toss with pasta and reserved water 1 min.
Blend peanut butter with milk to make light satay sauce.
Stir-fry broccoli and bell pepper 3 min.
Add diced barramundi; cook 4 min.
Pour satay sauce; simmer 3 min until thickened.
Pre-heat oven to 190 °C.
Flake lightly steamed ling; slice zucchini.
Whisk eggs, milk and flour.
Oil a baking dish; layer fish and zucchini, pour egg mix.
Bake 20 – 25 min until set.
Cook brown rice according to package directions and keep warm.
Slice vegetables thinly; mince the garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and stir 30 s.
Add carrots, broccoli and bell pepper; sauté 3 min.
Push veg to the sides, add barramundi pieces; sear 2 min per side until opaque.
Toss everything together for 1 min more and serve over the hot rice.
Rough-chop tomatoes and spinach.
In a bowl combine chickpeas, tomatoes and spinach.
Flake sardines into the mix.
Dress with olive oil and lemon juice; toss and serve.
Pre-heat oven to 200 °C.
Cut sweet potatoes into fries; slice onion.
Toss fries and onion with half the olive oil, spread on tray; bake 15 min.
Add broccoli florets and trout fillets (skin-side up), brush with remaining oil; bake 10 min more until trout flakes.
Serve immediately.
Cook pasta until al dente; reserve ¼ cup pasta water, drain.
Sauté onions and sliced mushrooms in olive oil 5 min.
Stir in tuna, milk and half the cheese; simmer 2 min.
Add pasta and reserved water; toss 1 min.
Top with remaining cheese and serve.
Heat oil in saucepan; sauté onion, bell pepper and garlic 4 min.
Add crushed tomatoes and chickpeas; simmer 8 min.
Nestle snapper pieces into sauce; cover and cook 6 min until fish flakes.
Serve stew over brown rice.
Boil and mash potatoes; cool slightly.
Flake steamed ling into mash; mix with beaten egg and flour.
Form 6 patties; pan-fry in olive oil 3 min each side.
Julienne apple and carrot; toss with spinach and a dash of olive oil.
Serve fishcakes with fresh slaw.
Sauté onion, carrot and garlic in oil 5 min.
Add crushed tomatoes, diced potatoes and 600 ml water; simmer 12 min.
Add cubed flathead; cook 6 min until opaque.
Stir in spinach; wilt 1 min and serve hot.
Rinse lentils; simmer in 500 ml water 20 min.
Meanwhile sauté onion, bell pepper and garlic in oil 4 min.
Add crushed tomatoes; simmer 5 min.
Add par-cooked lentils and diced kingfish; cook 6 min until fish done and lentils tender.
Season and serve.
Preheat oven to 190 °C.
Layer sliced zucchini, diced tomatoes, onion and garlic in a lightly oiled baking dish.
Dust basa fillets with flour; lay on top, drizzle with olive oil.
Cover with foil; bake 15 min, uncover and bake 10 min until fish flakes and veg soft.
Sear whiting fillets in olive oil 3 min per side; flake.
Combine warm brown rice and chickpeas in bowls.
Top with spinach, diced tomatoes and flaked whiting.
Drizzle with lemon juice and serve.
Pre-heat oven grill to high.
Blanch broccoli 2 min; drain.
Beat eggs with flour pinch salt; fold in sardines and broccoli.
Heat oil in oven-proof pan; pour mixture, cook 4 min then grill 3 min to set top.
Sauté onion & garlic 3 min in oil.
Add tomatoes, 250 ml water, cabbage; simmer 8 min.
Add basa, simmer 6 min; season with mild curry powder.
Cook pasta; reserve ¼ cup water, drain.
Sauté garlic & mushrooms 4 min; add mackerel to warm.
Off heat, stir in yogurt, pasta & reserved water 1 min; season.
Layer half potatoes in greased dish; top with flaked salmon.
Repeat layer; pour milk, drizzle oil, sprinkle cheese.
Cover, bake 20 min @ 190 °C; uncover 5 min to brown.
Mix yogurt with oil, salt, pepper.
Combine chicken, apple, spinach; fold through dressing.
Serve chilled.
Make dough with flour, warm water, pinch salt; roll 6 tortillas, dry-cook 1 min/side.
Sear fish in oil 3 min/side.
Toss apple & cabbage with squeeze of lemon.
Fill tortillas with fish & slaw.
Sauté onion & garlic 3 min in oil.
Add tomatoes, beans, 200 ml water; simmer 10 min.
Add fish; cook 6 min. Season with chili powder.
Toss cabbage with oil, place in baking dish.
Lay fish on top; smear yogurt mixed with flour & herbs.
Bake 18 min @ 190 °C until fish flakes.
Cook pasta, add broccoli last 2 min; drain, reserve ¼ cup water.
Blend peanut butter & milk for sauce.
Sear kingfish 4 min; combine with pasta, sauce & water 1 min.
Sear trout skin-side 3 min, flip 2 min; flake.
Sauté garlic & mushrooms 4 min.
Assemble rice bowls with veg & trout; drizzle yogurt thinned with water.
Stir-fry garlic, tofu & veg 4 min.
Add snapper; cook 4 min until opaque.
Season with soy sauce; serve with rice (optional).
Dust mackerel cubes with flour.
Stir-fry garlic & broccoli 3 min.
Add fish; cook 4 min until browned; splash water to steam 1 min.
Boil pasta 8 min; drain.
Combine pasta, salmon, milk, half cheese; transfer to dish.
Top with remaining cheese, drizzle oil; bake 12 min @ 190 °C.
Sauté garlic & zucchini 3 min.
Add whiting; cook 4 min per side.
Serve topped with yogurt mixed with lemon & herbs.
Dice fish and Sear fish in oil.
Allow fish to cool
Combine beans, pepper, cabbage in bowl.
Add cooled tuna; dress with oil & lemon.
Toss and serve chilled.
Heat oil in wok; stir-fry garlic 30 s.
Add chicken; cook 4 min.
Add cabbage and mushrooms; stir-fry 3 min.
Fold in rice; heat 2 min, season and serve.
Toss sweet potato and chicken with oil; bake 15 min @ 200 °C.
Scatter beans and cheese; bake 8 min more until golden.
Sear tofu in oil 3 min; push aside.
Add garlic and cabbage; stir-fry 3 min.
Stir in beans; heat 2 min, season lightly.
Blend all ingredients until creamy; serve immediately.
Cook pasta; reserve ¼ cup water, drain.
Sauté chicken in oil 4 min; add veg 4 min.
Toss with pasta, cheese and splash water 1 min.
Sauté sweet potato in oil 4 min.
Add tomatoes + 250 ml water; simmer 10 min.
Add tofu and beans; cook 5 min.
Off heat, swirl in yogurt, season.
Mix all ingredients; rest 5 min.
Form 6 patties; pan-fry 4 min/side until browned.
Whisk yogurt with pinch salt as dressing.
Toss chicken, cabbage, apple; coat with dressing.
Make quick wraps from flour + warm water; fill and fold.
Sauté tofu 3 min; add mushrooms 2 min.
Add zucchini noodles and grated sweet potato; stir-fry 3 min, season.
Mix all ingredients to batter; divide into 6 muffin cups.
Bake 18 min @ 180 °C until set.
Toss warm quinoa with olive oil and lemon juice.
Fold in chopped kale until wilted.
Top with black beans and pumpkin seeds; serve warm.
Dust chicken in flour, dip in egg, press into ground pumpkin seeds.
Pan-sear in olive oil 4 min/side, then finish 8 min in 180 °C oven.
Serve with grilled zucchini.
Sauté sweet potato in oil 4 min.
Add tomatoes and 150 ml water; simmer 10 min.
Stir in coconut milk and tofu; cook 6 min.
Fold in kale; wilt 1 min and serve.
Blend all ingredients until smooth; serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients to thick batter.
Cook 8 small pancakes in lightly oiled pan, 2 min/side.
Roast sweet potatoes 30 min @ 200 °C until tender; halve and scoop slightly.
Mix quinoa, beans, kale and half cheese; fill potatoes.
Top with remaining cheese; bake 5 min to melt.
Toss warm quinoa with olive oil and lemon juice.
Fold through kale until slightly wilted.
Add chicken and avocado; mix gently and serve.
Halve zucchinis lengthwise; scoop centres.
Sauté garlic, tofu and diced tomato 4 min; stir in ricotta.
Stuff mixture into zucchini shells; drizzle oil.
Bake 20 min at 190 °C.
Mix oats with 2 Tbsp water; press into greased pie dish as crust.
Par-bake 8 min at 180 °C.
Sauté mushrooms 4 min in oil.
Whisk eggs and milk; stir in cheese and mushrooms.
Pour over crust; bake 17 min until set.
Whisk yogurt and lemon for dressing.
Toss cabbage and apple; coat with dressing.
Top with pumpkin seeds and serve.
Combine all ingredients in a jar; refrigerate overnight.
Stir and eat cold.
Roast sweet potato 15 min at 200 °C.
Mix with beans and kale.
Make tortillas with flour & water; fill with mixture and roll.
Place in dish, cover with tomatoes and cheese; bake 10 min.
Mix yogurt, cucumber and garlic for tzatziki.
Make quick flatbreads; warm 1 min per side.
Fill with chicken, cabbage and tzatziki; wrap and serve.
Sauté onion and garlic 3 min.
Add cabbage plus 100 ml water; steam 5 min.
Pour coconut milk; add tofu; simmer 8 min, season and serve.
Blend all ingredients to a batter.
Cook pancakes 2 min per side on a medium pan.
Mix quinoa, yogurt, half cheese and broccoli; spread in dish.
Top with remaining cheese and pumpkin seeds; drizzle oil.
Bake 20 min at 190 °C until bubbly.
Toast bread lightly.
Mash avocado with lemon juice; spread on toast.
Top with kale and warm chicken slices; serve open-face.
Layer mushrooms and cheese between bread slices.
Pan-grill 4 min per side until golden and cheese melts.
Simmer beans and tomatoes 8 min to thicken.
Toss cabbage with lemon juice for quick slaw.
Spoon bean mix on toasted buns; top with slaw.
Sauté onion in oil 3 min.
Add chicken; brown 3 min.
Pour in 700 ml water; add cabbage; simmer 12 min.
Finish with lemon juice; season and serve hot.
Toss quinoa and kale with pesto and lemon juice.
Top with warm chicken slices; serve.
Sear tofu in oil 3 min; add mushrooms 2 min.
Add broccoli and 50 ml water; steam 3 min.
Stir in soy; glaze 1 min and serve with rice.
Make 4 tortillas; warm 1 min each side.
Spread tofu, tomatoes and cheese; fold and toast 2 min/side.
Toast bread; spread ricotta.
Top with avocado and kale; drizzle lemon juice.
Layer yogurt, berries, oats and chia in glass; serve chilled.
Arrange quinoa in bowls; add warm sweet potato, tofu and kale.
Sprinkle pumpkin seeds; drizzle optional lemon tahini.
Whisk soy and lemon for a light dressing.
Arrange rice in two bowls; top with salmon, cucumber ribbons and avocado.
Drizzle dressing just before serving.
Stir all ingredients in a jar; refrigerate overnight.
Enjoy chilled the next morning.
Make wraps from flour & warm water; cool.
Fold pesto into mashed chickpeas; spread on wraps.
Top with cucumber and spinach; roll and serve.
Heat oil; sauté garlic & ginger 30 s.
Add tofu; brown 3 min.
Add cabbage plus 50 ml water; stir-fry 3 min.
Splash soy, toss 1 min and serve.
Combine quinoa with pesto and half the cheese.
Fill mushroom caps; top with remaining cheese.
Bake 18 min at 190 °C until golden.
Whisk oil and lemon for dressing.
Toss spinach, chicken and blackberries; drizzle dressing.
Scatter pumpkin seeds just before serving.
Blend all ingredients until silky.
Chill 30 min; serve cold.
Mix soy and honey for glaze.
Sear fish 3 min/side; brush with glaze last minute.
Steam-sauté broccoli with garlic 4 min; plate with fish.
Warm oil in pan; toss zoodles 2 min.
Add lentils and tomatoes; heat 2 min.
Off heat, fold through pesto and serve.
Blend all ingredients to thick purée.
Pour into bowl; add any desired toppings.
